Posts.Content: If it's been going on for several years now, it's probably fine. When a nipple that's never been inverted before suddenly becomes inverted, then you need to get it checked out. Still, if it bugs you, you can ask your doctor. When you go for an annual exam, doctors should examine your breasts, also.
Posts.Title: inverted nipple!!!

Posts.Content: Women your age frequently get benign breast lumps. The fact that it hurts actually means it's less likely to be cancer. It might be some sort of cyst or infection, in which case the doctor might remove it. Or, it might go away on its own after your next period. Or it might be more serious, but you'll find out when you get your exam.
Posts.Title: Painful lumo under nipple

Posts.Content: I agree with Seraph. It's most likely a minor problem, a duct infection or even allergic reaction of some kind, but it could possibly be more serious. Call your doctor today, make an appointment to get it checked out, then you'll know for sure.
Posts.Title: Rash and hard breast

Posts.Content: Sometimes it just happens. If it happens suddenly in a woman who isn't going through any major hormonal changes, though, it should be checked out. So, probably nothing, but I'm glad you're getting checked out just to be sure.
Posts.Title: Inverted Nipple...

Posts.Content: Actually, this is one reason why they don't usually do mammograms in young women. Not only is breast cancer less likely, but it's just so darned hard to SEE anything, because the breast tissue is denser. If there was anything BIG in there, they'd probably have found it. They're just being thorough.
Posts.Title: Call back on mammogram - dense breasts

Posts.Content: Dense breasts are very common, especially in women under 40 or 50 years old. Past menopause, the breast tissue decreases. I doesn't mean anything is wrong, just that you have a lot of breast tissue, so they couldn't see everything clearly.
Posts.Title: Call back on mammogram - dense breasts

Posts.Content: The most likely explanation is an infection, treatable with antibiotics, such as infectious mastitis. Or it could be something else. See a doctor promptly.
Posts.Title: Left armpit and breast swollen and painful

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear you have to go through this! The good news is, almost 90% of abnormalities found on mammogram are benign when biopsied. When you go for biopsy, the doctor will use an ultrasound machine to place a long needle right into the "suspicious abnormality." He will remove a little tissue and send it to a lab for analysis. The bad news is, it'll be a while until you know for sure, because it takes 3-4 weeks for the biopsy results to come back. Still, it's good that you are getting tested appropriately. If it is benign, maybe it's still something a surgeon could remove, to relieve your pain.
Posts.Title: Category 4 mammo US results

Posts.Content: They are both saying approximately the same thing. You have some benign growths, and you have very dense breasts. For now you are ok: "No evidence of infiltrative malignancy." They will keep a close eye on your breasts in the future, though.
Posts.Title: Category 4 mammo US results
